contentrichtext.text: {{Prose|date=May 2010}} [[Image:Guyane map-en.svg|thumb|right|Geographic map of French Guiana]] '''[[French Guiana]]''' is an [[overseas region]] of France, located on the northern coast of [[South America]] between [[Suriname]] and [[Brazil]]. ==Location== Northern [[South America]] and part of [[Caribbean South America]], bordering the North [[Atlantic Ocean]], between [[Brazil]] and [[Suriname]] ==Geographic coordinates== {{Coord|4|00|N|53|00|W|type:country}} ==Map references== South America ==Area== total: 91,000 km²<br> land: 89,150 km²<br> water: 1,850 km² == Land boundaries == total: 1,183 km<br> border countries: Brazil 673 km, Suriname 510 km (disputed)<br> Coastline: 378 km ==Maritime claims== exclusive economic zone: {{convert|200|nmi|km mi|1|abbr=on|lk=in}} territorial sea: {{convert|12|nmi|km mi|1|abbr=on}} ==Climate== Tropical; hot, ==Terrain== low-lying coastal plains rising to hills and small mountains, see [[Guiana Shield]] ==Elevation extremes== lowest point: Atlantic Ocean 0 m<br> highest point: [[Bellevue de l'Inini]] 851 m<br> other mountains: [[Montaigne d'Argent]], on the edge of [[Oiapoque river]] regions: 432 m ==Natural resources== [[bauxite]], [[timber]], [[gold]] (widely scattered), [[cinnabar]], [[kaolin]], [[fish]], [[shrimp]] ==Land use== arable land: 0%<br> permanent crops: 0%<br> permanent pastures: 0%<br> forests and woodland: 0%<br> other: 10% (1996 est.)<br> irrigated land: 20 km² (1993 est.)<br> natural hazards: high frequency of heavy showers and severe thunderstorms; flooding<br> environment - current issues: NA<br> geography - note: mostly an unsettled wilderness {{Geography of South America}} {{South America topic|Climate of}} [[Category:Geography of French Guiana| ]]
